keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, with the final beating in the infirmary being fatal and captured on silent body-camera footage.

David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though Kieffer and Galliher were charged with second-degree gang assault and Kieffer with filing a false instrument.

The body-camera footage, though silent, showed guards actively punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, with no visible concern, contributing significantly to public outrage and the prosecution's case.

Brooks, serving a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault since 2017, sustained severe injuries including a broken nose, black eye, and internal organ damage, with blood leaking into his lungs and stomach.

William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, argued that all guards acted as a gang and showed a 'depraved indifference to human life,' leading to murder charges under first-degree manslaughter and murder statutes.

Six of the 10 guards indicted in February were charged with murder, five of whom pleaded guilty to manslaughter, and another pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor of attempted tampering with physical evidence.
Three guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two former guards who testified at trial.
Another corrections officer is scheduled to go on trial for second-degree manslaughter in January 2025.
William Fitzpatrick took over the case after state Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing several officers in civil lawsuits.

Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025, beating and death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, where 10 guards were indicted, including two charged with murder.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the fatal beating of inmate Robert Brooks, who was pummeled upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage, revealed guards actively assaulting Brooks in the infirmary, with severe injuries including organ damage and internal bleeding. While Kingsley was convicted, guards Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though both faced lesser charges. The case sparked public outrage and highlighted systemic issues in prison conduct. William Fitzpatrick, appointed as special prosecutor after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself, is prosecuting both this case and a similar incident involving the death of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility in March 2025. Multiple guards have either pleaded guilty to reduced charges or are set to go on trial, underscoring a broader pattern of misconduct and accountability failures in New York's correctional system.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
